query: Can the conference provide visa letter for attendees?
output: Yes, the conference can provide an invitation letter for obtaining a VISA. This is applicable for those who have submitted a paper to the main conference ACL 2023 as an author (including co-authors) and their Softconf ID is associated with the submission.

query: What is ACL student research workshop?
output: The ACL Student Research Workshop (SRW) is a forum associated with the ACL 2023 conference where students who are studying areas of Computational Linguistics, Natural Language Processing and Machine Learning can present their research. The workshop provides an opportunity for participants to receive mentorship and valuable feedback from the international research community. It is aimed at helping students at various stages of their education, from undergraduate to PhD level, in familiarising themselves with conducting and presenting their research.

query: What is the new award policy implemented by ACL2023?
output: The new award policy implemented by ACL2023 aims for broader recognition of exceptional research by significantly increasing the pool of outstanding papers to 1.5-2.5% of the total submissions. This has resulted in 3 best papers, 4 special awards papers (Resource Award, Social Impact Award, Reproduction Award, Theme Paper Award), and 39 outstanding papers. Additionally, the Senior Area Chairs of each track had the opportunity to nominate one of their papers for a separate award. The nominated papers comprised only 1.6% of the total submissions.

query: What are the responsibilities of the organizers of the accepted proposals?
output: The organizers of the accepted proposals are responsible for publicizing and running the workshop, reviewing submissions, producing the camera-ready workshop proceedings, organizing the meeting days, and ensuring all participants are aware of ACL’s anti-harassment policy. They also have to commit to all deadlines, as failure to produce the camera-ready proceedings on time will lead to the exclusion of the workshop from proceedings and indexes. They cannot accept submissions for publication that have been published elsewhere, though they can set their own policies on simultaneous submission and review. Timelines for submission, review, and preparation of copies will be different for each conference, and the organizers should not deviate from the suggested timeline unless absolutely necessary and agreed upon by the Workshop Chairs.

query: What is Computational Linguistics?
output: Computational linguistics is the scientific study of language from a computational perspective. Computational linguists are interested in providing computational models of various kinds of linguistic phenomena. These models may be “knowledge-based” (“hand-crafted”) or “data-driven” (“statistical” or “empirical”). Work in computational linguistics is in some cases motivated from a scientific perspective in that one is trying to provide a computational explanation for a particular linguistic or psycholinguistic phenomenon; and in other cases the motivation may be more purely technological in that one wants to provide a working component of a speech or natural language system. The work of computational linguists is incorporated into many working systems today, including speech recognition systems, text-to-speech synthesizers, automated voice response systems, web search engines, text editors, language instruction materials, among others.

query: What is the cancelation policy of regisration?
output:
The cancellation policy of registration is as follows:

If you cancel your registration one month or more prior to the conference (June 09, 2023, or before), you will be refunded the full amount paid, minus up to a $50 processing fee. 

If you cancel up to three weeks prior to the conference (June 16, 2023), you will be refunded the ACL membership (if it was paid as part of the registration) and any amounts paid over and above the first $200. 

Cancellations 2 weeks prior to the start of the conference (June 23, 2023), and all no-shows, will not be refunded any amount. However, they will be able to retain the current full year ACL membership (if paid as part of the registration) and have access virtually.

Exceptions to this policy include cancellation due to governmental travel restrictions, failure to obtain a visa, or serious illness that prevents travel to the conference. In these cases, you will be refunded the full amount paid (minus up to a $50 processing fee) regardless of when the notification is received by the ACL Office. You must submit documentation supporting the above cancellation exceptions. For questions about your registration and/or payment, you can contact Yes Events via email at ACLinfo@yesevents.com or toll-free at 800-937-872.
